text: Highway 12 or British Columbia Highway 12, opened in 1953, is a road from the Trans-Canada Highway at Lytton to the town of Lillooet, one of two roads between the Thompson-Nicola and Squamish-Lillooet Regional Districts. When a portion of the highway was paved in 1992, the section between Highway 97 and Lillooet was renamed as Highway 99. ==References== Category:Roads in Canada
title: British Columbia Highway 12
